intro: Chrysopia urophylla, commonly known as the yellow oxeye daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open woodlands, preferring well-drained soils. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in spring and summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
